definition[0]: not considered to be modern or fashionable anymore
example[2]: The idea seems rather old-fashioned now.
definition[1]: someone who is old-fashioned has ideas, attitudes etc that were more usual in the past than now
example[3]: He’s very old-fashioned when it comes to music.
definition[2]: not considered modern or fashionable – used about styles of clothes, furniture etc, or about words and ideas
example[4]: The room was full of big old-fashioned furniture.
example[5]: I can’t wear that dress – it’s too old-fashioned.
example[6]: He had a lot of good old-fashioned values.
definition[3]: not containing the most recent information and therefore not useful
definition[4]: used about machines, equipment, or methods that are old-fashioned and have been replaced by better, more recent ones
example[8]: In today’s world, technology rapidly becomes outdated.
example[9]: The accident was blamed on an outdated rail network.
definition[5]: used about styles etc that were fashionable until recently but now look old-fashioned
example[10]: The pictures in this book already look a bit dated.
example[11]: I liked the food but the decor in the restaurant was very dated.
definition[6]: not fashionable and not popular with people anymore
example[12]: They lived in an unfashionable part of London.
example[13]: The word ‘patriotic’ has become rather unfashionable these days.
definition[7]: old-fashioned – used about machines and equipment that are no longer being produced because better ones have been invented
example[14]: These days, you buy a computer and it’s almost immediately obsolete.
example[15]: Many laboratories use obsolete equipment and do not receive enough funding.
definition[8]: old and not suitable for modern needs and conditions
